src:
Nadal čeka rezultate: Od ovoga zavisi nastup u Londonu
04 Nov 2019, 18:15 by Zile
Dugo očekivana londonska borba između Novaka Đokovića i Rafaela Nadala za pvu poziciju na kraju 2019. godine možda se uopšte neće dogoditi.
Rafael Nadal je u subotu predao polufinale Mastersa u Parizu, u ponedeljak se vratio na čelo ATP liste, a danas je obavio dodatne preglede nakon kojih će doneti odluku da li će nastupiti u Londonu.
Doktor Anhel Luiz Kotoro obavio je magnetnu rezonancu trbušnog zida, čiji će rezultati biti poznati u utorak, a nakon toga će sa Nadalom i njegovim timom obaviti konsultacije oko nastupa na ATP finalu.
Nadal je u karijeri 15 puta izborio plasman na završni turnir sezone, ali je do sada čak 6 puta morao da odustane zbog povrede. Ne treba smetnuti sa uma da posle ATP finala sledi i borba za trofej u Dejvis Kupu pa će Nadal i o tome voditi računa kada bude donosio odluku o nastupu u Londonu.
Pored Nadala i Đokovića plasman na ATP finale izborili su Rodžer Federer, Danil Medvedev, Dominik Tim, Stefanos Cicipas, Aleksandar Zverev i Mateo Beretini, a prve dve rezerve su Roberto Bautista-Agut i Gael Monfis.

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Nadal is waiting for the results: The London performance depends on this
04 Nov 2019, 17:15 by Zile
The long-awaited London fight between Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal for the first position at the end of 2019 may not happen at all.
Rafael Nadal surrendered the Masters semifinals in Paris on Saturday, returning to the top of the ATP list on Monday, and today carried out additional screenings after which he will decide whether to play in London.
Anhel Luiz Kotoro, MD, performed an abdominal magnetic resonance scan, the results of which will be known on Tuesday, and will then consult with Nadal and his team about appearing in the ATP final.
Nadal made 15 career appearances in the final tournament of the season, but has had to give up 6 times because of injury. It should be borne in mind that after the ATP finals, the Davis Cup trophy will follow, so Nadal will also keep that in mind when deciding whether to play in London.
In addition to Nadal and Djokovic, Roger Federer, Danil Medvedev, Dominik Tim, Stefanos Cicipas, Alexander Zverev and Mateo Beretini also took the standings, with Roberto Bautista-Agut and Gael Monfis taking the top two.
